Class summary: LesionFROC: ... (not given). But we can infer: LesionFROC likely computes Free-response Receiver Operating Characteristic (FROC) for lesion detection in pathology images. It probably uses probability NMS, compute isolated tumor cells, multi-instance mask, etc.

Standalone function: tqdm: Simple helper tqdm.

Thus summary: module provides functionality to evaluate lesion detection performance using FROC metrics for whole slide images in pathology, handling probability maps, non-maximum suppression, isolated tumor cell detection, multi-instance masks, computing false positive/true positive probabilities, generating FROC curve data and score.

Business intent: Provide quantitative assessment of lesion detection algorithms in digital pathology, enabling researchers/clinicians to benchmark models.

Keywords: lesion detection, FROC, pathology, whole slide imaging, evaluation metric, non-maximum suppression, isolated tumor cells, multi-instance mask, false positive, true positive, compute_froc_score, compute_fp_tp_probs, compute_froc_curve_data, MONAI.

{
  "summary": "The module implements the LesionFROC class, which evaluates lesion detection performance on whole‑slide pathology images using Free‑response Receiver Operating Characteristic (FROC) analysis.   "business_intent": "To provide researchers and clinicians with a ready‑to‑use tool for quantitatively benchmarking and comparing lesion detection algorithms in digital pathology workflows.",
